locale.name: en_US
locale.message: Are you sure you want to reset all email templates in this Imprint? You will lose any customizations you have made.
Note: The Files Browser is an advanced feature that allows the files and directories associated with a Imprint to be viewed and manipulated directly.
Have title appear under Editorial Team in People section of About the Imprint (e.g. Editor)
Have title appear as its own category under People (e.g. Editorial Board)
OJS lists people in Editorial Team under assigned roles (Imprint Manager, CopyEditor, etc.)
The Imprint Manager creates titles and adds people under each title.
No Editorial team positions have been created.
This will replace any locale-specific Imprint settings you had for this locale

OJS can be made available to users in any of several supported languages. As well, OJS can operate as a multilingual system, providing users with an ability to toggle between languages on each page, and allowing certain data to be entered in several additional languages.

If a language supported by OJS is not listed below, ask your Editor-in-Chief to install the language from the site administration interface. For instructions on adding support for new languages, please consult the OJS documentation.
Sorry, no additional languages are available. Contact your Editor-in-Chief if you wish to use additional languages with this Imprint.
This will be the default language for the Imprint site.

Selected options, along with their descriptions and fees (which can be edited below), will appear in Step 1 of the submission process and in About the Imprint under Submissions, as well as at points where payment is required.
OJS does not perform any currency conversions. If accepting payments for subscriptions, you must ensure that the subscription currency matches the one specified here.
All costs must be positive numeric values (decimal points are allowed)
The Association Membership will appear in About the Imprint under Policies, and the donations link will appear above the search function in the right-hand frame.
This will activate payments for Subscriptions, where types, cost, duration and subscriptions are managed by the Imprint (Subscription) Manager.
Click here to enable the Payments module. You must configure payment settings by filling in the form below. Note Users will be required to log in to make payments.
Only Restrict Access to PDF version of articles
You may configure any of the following Payment Method Plugins from this screen.
Selected options, along with their descriptions and fees (which can be edited below), will appear in About the Imprint under Policies, as well as at points where payment is required.
Enroll a User from this Site in this Imprint
Remove this user from this Imprint? This action will unenroll the user from all roles within this Imprint.

Select a user (or several) to merge into another user account (e.g., when someone has two user accounts). The account(s) selected first will be deleted and any submissions, assignments, etc. will be attributed to the second account.
Select a user to whom to attribute the previous users' authorships, editing assignments, etc.

Enrollment synchronization will enroll all users enrolled in the specified role in the specified Imprint into the same role in this Imprint. This function allows a common set of users (e.g., Reviewers) to be synchronized between journals.

Plugin was not successfully copied. This may be a permissions problem. Please make sure that the web server is able to write to the plugins directory (including subdirectories) but don't forget to secure it again later.
Are you sure you wish to delete this plugin from the system?
By clicking delete, you will delete the plugin from the server's file system.

Plugin could not be deleted from the file system. This may be a permissions problem. Please make sure that the web server is able to write to the plugins directory (including subdirectories) but don't forget to secure it again later.

This page allows the Imprint Manager to review and potentially configure the plugins that are currently installed. Plugins are divided into categories, according to their function. The categories are listed below, and within each category, its current set of plugins.
This form allows you to upload and install a new plugin. Please ensure the plugin is compressed as a .tar.gz file.
Plugin already exists, and is newer or equal to installed version
Plugin already exists, and is older or equal to the installed version
The uploaded plugin archive does not contain a folder that corresponds to the plugin name.
Plugin does not exist. Please Install instead
Plugin already exists, but is newer than installed version. Please upgrade instead
The tar command is not available. Please correctly configure it in your "config.inc.php".
This form allows you to upgrade a plugin. Please ensure the plugin is compressed as a .tar.gz file.
version.xml in plugin directory contains invalid data.
version.xml not found in plugin directory
Warning: Changing the review form element type from a multiple-choice type to an open-ended type will result in the deletion of the multiple choice options.
Checkboxes (you can choose one or more)
Are you sure you wish to delete an element of a published review form?
An item type is required for the form item.
A question is required for the form item.
No form items have been created.
Radio buttons (you can only choose one)
Are you sure you wish to delete this unpublished review form?
A title is required for the review form.

The peer review forms created here will be presented to reviewers to complete, instead of the default form which consists of two open text boxes, the first "for author and Editor," and the second "for Editor." Review forms can be designated for a specific Imprint section, and Editors will have the option to choose which form to use in assigning the review. In all cases, Editors will have the option of including the reviews in corresponding with the author.
No review forms have been created.
Are you sure you want to permanently delete this section? You will have to re-publish any articles in this section.
Disable reader comments for this section.

Add a Section Editor to this section to have submissions automatically assigned to the Section Editor. (Otherwise, Section Editors can be assigned manually, after a submission comes in.) If added, a Section Editor can be automatically assigned to oversee the REVIEW (peer review) and/or the EDITING (copyediting, layout and proofreading) of submissions to this section. Section Editors are created by clicking Section Editors under Roles in Imprint Management.
Items can only be submitted by Editors and Section Editors.
An abbreviated title is required for the section
Please ensure that at least one checkbox is checked for each Section Editor assignment.
Please ensure that you have chosen a valid review form.
A title is required for the section.
Omit this section from About the Imprint.
Omit author names for section items from books' table of contents.
Omit the title of this section from books' table of contents.
Identify items published in this section as a(n)
(For example, "Peer-reviewed Article", "Non-refereed Book Review", "Invited Commentary", etc.)
Will not be included in the indexing of the Imprint
Submissions made to this section of the Imprint
Limit description word counts for this section (0 for no limit):
Add Item to Appear in "About the Imprint"
Add the following content, using text/HTML, which will appear below the homepage image, if one is uploaded.
Alternately, instead of title and logo, an HTML version of the header can be inserted into the text box below. Leave textbox blank if not required.
Announcements may be published to inform readers of Imprint news and events. Published announcements will appear on the Announcements page.
Enter any additional information that should be displayed to readers on the Announcements page.
Require authors to agree to Copyright Notice as part of the submission process.

The Copyright Notice entered below will appear in About the Imprint and in each published item's metadata. While it is up to the Imprint to determine the nature of its copyright agreement with authors, the Public Knowledge Project recommends the use of the Creative Commons license. To that end, it provides sample Copyright Notice wording that can be cut and pasted into the space below for journals that (a) offer open access, (b) offer delayed open access, or (c) do not offer open access.

Set out for authors the bibliographic and formatting standards used for items submitted to the Imprint (e.g., Publication Manual of the American Psychological Association, 5th edition, 2001). It is often helpful to provide examples of the common citation formats for journals and books to be used in submissions. Also identify the types of appropriate Supplementary Files (e.g., data-sets, research instruments, etc.) which authors should be encouraged to upload, in addition to their submission, to enhance readers' engagement with their work.
Biomedical journals typically require authors and reviewers to declare if they have any competing interests with regard to their research (see PLoS Policy).
Guidelines for filing a Competing Interest statement
Require submitting Authors to file a Competing Interest (CI) statement with their submission.
Require Reviewers to file a CI statement with each peer review they submit.
This text will appear below the "Sources of Support" heading and above the list of names and urls for supporting organizations under "Imprint Sponsorship" on the "About" page.
Additional agencies or organizations that provide financial or in-kind support for the Imprint will appear in About the Imprint and may be accompanied by a note of acknowledgement.
This text will appear in the "About" section of the Imprint website and can be used to describe changes in titles, Editorial board, and other items of relevance to the Imprint's publication history.

The Copyedit Instructions will be made available to CopyEditors, Authors, and Section Editors in the Submission Editing stage. Below is a default set of instructions in HTML, which can be modified or replaced by the Imprint Manager at any point (in HTML or plain text).
(E.g., European Renaissance; Jurassic Period; Third Trimester; etc.)
Provide examples of relevant chronological or historical terms for this field
Refers to geo-spatial location, chronological or historical coverage, and/or characteristics of research sample.
(E.g., Iberian Peninsula; Stratosphere; Boreal Forest; etc.)
Provide examples of relevant geo-spatial or geographical terms for this field
Provide examples of research sample characteristics for this field
Custom HTML header tags to be inserted in the header of every page (e.g., META tags).
Name of Imprint, ISSN, contacts, sponsors, and search engines.
The public-facing User registration form is disabled for this Imprint. The Imprint Manager can still manually register users.
Useful when Imprint crosses disciplinary boundaries and/or authors submit multidisciplinary items.
(E.g., History; Education; Sociology; Psychology; Cultural Studies; Law)
Provide examples of relevant academic disciplines for this Imprint
Add the table of contents for the current book (if available).
The DOI (Digital Object Identifier) Prefix is assigned by CrossRef and is in the format 10.xxxx (e.g. 10.1234).
Use the pattern entered below to generate DOI suffixes. Use %j for Imprint initials, %v for the volume number, %i for the book number, %a for the OJS article ID, and %p for the page number.
For example, vol%viss%ipp%p could create a DOI such as 10.1234/vol3iss2pp230
A DOI suffix can take any form, but must be unique for each published item.
Use the "Custom Identifier" for published items as the DOI suffix (must be enabled in Step 4).

If you change your DOI configuration, DOIs that have already been assigned will not be affected. Once the DOI configuration is saved, use this button to clear all existing DOIs so that the new settings will take effect with existing articles.
Go to Board Members and add Editorial Board and/or Review Board members. This can be done at any point in operating the Imprint.
One or more Editors handle the basic steps without designated roles.
Managing Editor handles Submission Queue, and Table of Contents, while Section Editors handle Submission Review and Submission Editing.
Managing Editor handles Submission Queue, Submission Editing, and Table of Contents, while the Section Editors handle Submission Review.

Journals have Editorial Boards to oversee the Editorial direction of the Imprint, participate in the appointment of Editors, and, by virtue of board members' reputations, give the Imprint some standing in the field. Review Boards play a similar role but in addition, they lead the peer review process. Review Board members will not have access to the Imprint's administrative system but will be added to the list of those available to do peer reviews.
Any undeliverable emails will result in an error message to this address.

Note: To activate this option, the Editor-in-Chief must enable the allow_envelope_sender option in the OJS configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OJS documentation.

The prepared emails that are sent by the system on behalf of the Imprint will have the following signature added to the end. The body of the prepared emails are available for editing under Imprint Management.
Enable Imprint Managers to add Imprint announcements.
of the most recent announcements on the Imprint homepage.
Page numbers for items will be calculated and entered manually in the Table of Contents (e.g., pp. 13-26).
Custom identifiers will be used to identify published items.
Custom identifiers will be used to identify galleys (e.g. HTML or PDF files) for published items.
Custom identifiers will be used to identify books.
Custom identifiers will be used to identify supplemental article files.
Users can register themselves with the Imprint in one or more of the following roles:
Authors (can submit materials to the Imprint)
Readers (will receive notifications and be counted as equivalent to a subscriber)
Enter a statement below, which will appear in About the Imprint, that speaks to authors, readers, and librarians about the range of articles and other items which the Imprint will publish.
For Authors to Index Their Work

OJS adheres to the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting, which is the emerging standard for providing well-indexed access to electronic research resources on a global scale. The authors will use a similar template to provide metadata for their submission. The Imprint Manager should select the categories for indexing and present authors with relevant examples to assist them in indexing their work, separating terms with a semi-colon (e.g., term1; term2). The entries should be introduced as examples by using "E.g.," or "For example,".
The primary contact email is required.
The primary contact name is required.
The number of reviewers per submission is required.
The DOI pattern must be in the form 10.xxxx.
Set the initial book/volume numbers and year for the first publication of the Imprint, as well as intended frequency for book/volumes.
Note: Leave items blank if not used with this Imprint, and Editors can re-set numbers in the publishing process.
Add an image or graphic file to the middle of the page.
For journals that offer immediate or delayed open access, include a Creative Commons license with all published work at the appropriate time.
Brief descriptions of the Imprint for librarians and prospective authors and readers are available in the "Information" section of the sidebar.
Depending on the format selected, identify the book, volume, and/or year of the first book to be published with OJS:

The ISSN (International Standard Serial Number) is an eight-digit number which identifies periodical publications as such, including electronic serials. It is managed by a world wide network of National Centres coordinated by an International Centre based in Paris, backed by Unesco and the French Government. A number can be obtained from the ISSN web site. This can be done at any point in operating the Imprint.
Navigation bar items can be added to the current set (Home, About, User Home, etc.) that appear at the top of the page.
Add a brief 20-25 word description in text/HTML which will appear just below the navigation links.
Add a favicon for this Imprint to display alongside the navigation bar when users are visiting your site.
Invalid favicon format. Accepted formats are .ico, .png, and .gif.

By default, the homepage consists of navigation links. Additional homepage content can be appended by using one or all of the following options, which will appear in the order shown. Note that the current book is always accessible through the Current link in the navigation bar.
A graphic version of the Imprint's title and logo (as a .gif, .jpg, or .png file) can be uploaded for the homepage, which will replace the text version that otherwise appears.

Choose a Imprint theme and select layout components here. A Imprint stylesheet may also be uploaded, which can be used to override style data in the system-wide stylesheets and theme stylesheet (if a theme is chosen).

This is the footer of your Imprint. To change or update the footer, paste the HTML code in the textbox below. Examples could be another navigation bar, a counter, etc. This footer will appear on every page.

A graphic version of the Imprint's title and logo (.gif, .jpg, or .png file), possibly a smaller version of the one used on the homepage, can be uploaded to appear as a header on Imprint pages, which will replace the text version that otherwise appears.
Your Imprint setup has been updated.
Invalid Imprint stylesheet format. Accepted format is .css.

Layout Instructions can be prepared for the formatting of publishing items in the Imprint and be entered below in HTML or plain text. They will be made available to the Layout Editor and Section Editor on the Editing page of each submission. (As each Imprint may employ its own file formats, bibliographic standards, style sheets, etc., a default set of instructions is not provided.)

Templates can be uploaded to appear in Layout for each of the standard formats published in the Imprint (e.g., article, book review, etc.) using any file format (e.g., pdf, doc, etc.) with annotations added specifying font, size, margins, etc. to serve as a guide for Layout Editors and Proofreaders.
Enter the maximum number of items (for example, submissions, users, or editing assignments) that appear on each page of a list, and the number of pages links to display on each page.
Enable LOCKSS to store and distribute Imprint content at participating libraries via a LOCKSS Publisher Manifest page. A LOCKSS license will appear in About the Imprint under Archiving:
See other versions of a LOCKSS license.

Identify 6-10 libraries that will register and cache the Imprint. For example, turn to institutions where Editors or Board members work and/or institutions already participating in LOCKSS. See participating libraries. Use the prepared invitations for (i) libraries participating in LOCKSS or (ii) libraries not yet participating in LOCKSS.
Homepage header, content, Imprint header, footer, navigation bar, and style sheet.
The Imprint's physical location and mailing address.
Access and security, scheduling, announcements, copyediting, layout, and proofreading.
Add or remove additional navigation bar items.
URL is an absolute URL (e.g., "http://www.example.com") rather than a path relative to the site (e.g., "/manager/setup")
The label value is a literal string (e.g., "Imprint Setup") rather than a localization message key (e.g., "manager.setup")
Send a copy to the Imprint's primary contact, identified in Setup Step 1.
Send a copy to this email address:

On completing the submission process, authors are automatically sent an acknowledgement email (which can be viewed and edited in Prepared Emails). In addition, a copy of the acknowledgement email can be sent as follows:
Note: The submission acknowledgement email is currently disabled. To use this feature, enable the SUBMISSION_ACK email in Prepared Emails.
When using the Notify Author email, include the email addresses of all co-authors for multiple-author submissions, and not just the submitting user.
Copyediting will be undertaken by an Editor or Section Editor assigned to the submission.
An Editor or Section Editor assigned to the submission will prepare the HTML, PDF, etc., files.
An Editor or Section Editor assigned to the submission will check the galleys.
The Imprint will provide open access to its contents.
If the Imprint will provide readers with immediate free access to all published content, enter an Open Access Policy which will appear in About the Imprint under Policies.

Outline the Imprint's peer review policy and processes for readers and authors, including the number of reviewers typically used in reviewing a submission, the criteria by which reviewers are asked to judge submissions, typical time taken to conduct the reviews, and the principles for recruiting reviewers. This will appear in About the Imprint.
Focus, peer review, sections, privacy, security, and additional about items.

This position, which can be treated as a principal Editorship, managing Editorship, or administrative staff position, will be listed on the homepage of the Imprint under Contact, along with the Technical Support Contact.
This statement will appear in About the Imprint, as well as on the Author Submission and Notification sign-up pages. Below is a recommended privacy policy, which can be revised at any point.

The Proofreading Instructions will be made available to Proofreaders, Authors, Layout Editors, and Section Editors in the Submission Editing stage. Below is a default set of instructions in HTML, which can be edited or replaced by the Imprint Manager at any point (in HTML or plain text).
The Imprint will use the following elements to identify books (which can be overridden for individual books).

Imprint items can be published collectively, as part of an book with its own Table of Contents. Alternatively, individual items can be published as soon as they are ready, by adding them to the "current" volume's Table of Contents. Provide readers, in About the Imprint, with a statement about the system this Imprint will use and its expected frequency of publication.
This text will appear below the "Publisher" heading and above the publisher name/url under "Imprint Sponsorship" on the "About" page.
The name of the organization publishing the Imprint will appear in About the Imprint.
Users must be registered and log in to view open access content.
Users must be registered and log in to view the Imprint site.
Add to the Select Reviewer page a link to a relevant literature database that can be searched for potential reviewers and is open to Editors without subscription.

The Review Guidelines will provide reviewers with criteria for judging a submission's suitability for publication in the Imprint, and can include any special instructions for preparing an effective and helpful review. In conducting the review, reviewers are presented with with two open text boxes, the first "for author and Editor," and the second "for Editor." Alternatively, the Imprint Manager can create a peer review form under Review Forms. In all cases, Editors will have the option of including the reviews in corresponding with the author.
Automated email reminders (available in OJS's default Emails) can be sent to reviewers at two points (while the Editor can always email the reviewer directly as well)

Note: To activate these options, the Editor-in-Chief must enable the scheduled_tasks option in the OJS configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OJS documentation.
Can be modified during the Editorial process.
The typical period of time allowed for reviews
Editors will rate reviewers on a five-point quality scale after each review.
If reviewer has not responded to a review request within
If reviewer has not submitted a recommendation within
Reviewers will have access to the submission file only after agreeing to review it.

Note: The email invitation to reviewers will contain a special URL that takes invited reviewers directly to the Review page for the submission (with access to any other pages requiring them to log in). For security reasons with this option, Editors are not able to modify email addresses or add CCs or BCCs prior to sending invitations to reviewers.
Provide links to Ensuring a Blind Review on pages where authors and reviewers upload files.

Three models are supported for managing the review process.

Select one of the following:

Editors will email selected Reviewers the title and description of the submission, as well as an invitation to log into the Imprint web site to complete the review. Reviewers enter the Imprint web site to agree to do the review, to download submissions, submit their comments, and select a recommendation.
Reviewers will select submissions they wish to review. Editors oversee the review process, making review round decisions when sufficient reviewer comments are received.

Reviewers will select submissions they wish to review. Editors oversee the review process, however there are no review rounds. An submission may ultimately be accepted, or the author can withdraw from the review process when sufficient reviews are received.
To assist the users of search engines in discovering this Imprint, provide a brief description of the Imprint and relevant keywords (separated by semicolons).
(If sections are not added, then items are submitted to the Articles section by default.)

To create or modify sections for the Imprint (e.g., Articles, Book Reviews, etc.), go to Section Management.

Authors on submitting items to the Imprint will designate...
OJS provides a number of security-related options that can be used to restrict the Imprint's contents, and maintain additional information about submissions for auditing purposes.
The Imprint Editor who will see it through the Editorial process.
The Imprint section for which the item will be considered.
Always show galley links and indicate restricted access.
Additional Site and Article Access Restrictions
This text will appear below the "Sponsors" heading and above the list of sponsor names and urls under "Imprint Sponsorship" on the "About" page.

The name of the organizations (e.g., scholarly associations, university departments, cooperatives, etc.) sponsoring the Imprint will appear in About the Imprint and may be accompanied by a note of acknowledgement.
Five Steps to a Imprint Web Site
(E.g., Mathematics Subject Classification; Library of Congress Classification)
(E.g., Photosynthesis; Black Holes; Four-Color Map Problem; Bayesian Theory)
Provide examples of keywords or topics as a guide for authors
Maintain a log of all emails sent in relation to a submission on its History page.
Maintain a log of all actions taken with a submission on its History page.

On making a submission to the Imprint, authors are first asked to check each item on the Submission Preparation Checklist as completed, before proceeding. The checklist also appears in the Author Guidelines, under About the Imprint. The list can be edited below, but all items on the list will require a checkmark before authors can proceed with their submission.
Author guidelines, copyright, and indexing (including registration).
The Imprint will require subscriptions to access some or all of its contents.
This requires the assignment of a Subscription Manager who has access to the subscription module, which includes additional open access, self-archiving, and email notification options.
The Imprint's contents will not be published online.

This person will be listed on the Imprint's Contact page for the use of Editors, authors, and reviewers, and should have experience working through the system from the perspective of all of its roles. As this Imprint system requires very little technical support, this should be seen as a part-time assignment. There may be occasions, for example, when authors and reviewers have difficulties with the instructions or file formats, or there's a need to ensure that the Imprint is regularly backed up on the server.
(E.g., Historical Inquiry; Quasi-Experimental; Literary Analysis; Survey/Interview)
Provide examples of relevant research types, methods, and approaches for this field
Articles and books can be tagged with an identification number or string, employing a registration system such as the Digital Object Identifier System (DOI).
A CopyEditor will be assigned to work with each submission.
An Editorial/review board will be used by the Imprint.
A Layout Editor will be assigned to prepare the HTML, PDF, etc., files for electronic publication.
A Proofreader will be assigned to check (along with the authors) the galleys prior to publication.

OJS generates reports that track the details associated with processing submissions to the Imprint from the perspective of submissions, Editors, reviewers, and sections, over a given period of time. Reports are generated in CSV format which requires a spreadsheet application to view.

OJS calculates the following statistics for each Imprint. The "days to review" is calculated from date of submission (or designation of Review Version) to the initial Editor Decision, while the "days to publish" is measured for accepted submissions from its original uploading to its publication.
Check items to be made available to readers in About the Imprint.
Note: Percentages for peer reviewed submissions may not add up to 100%, as items resubmitted are either accepted, declined, or still in process.
Select the sections for calculating this Imprint's peer-reviewed statistics.
The following Author Self-Archiving Policy will be included in About the Imprint under Policies.
With delayed open access, Editors are still able to designate specific articles within an book for immediate open access.
The back books of this Imprint will be available in an open access format
month(s) after a book is published.
Please select a valid duration length.
The following Delayed Open Access Policy will be posted in About the Imprint under Policies.
Upon subscription expiry, readers may be denied access to all subscription content or may continue to retain access to subscription content published prior to the subscription expiry date.
Readers are denied access to all subscription content upon subscription expiry.
Readers are denied access to recently published subscription content, but retain access to subscription content published prior to the subscription expiry date.
Automated email reminders (available for editing by Imprint Managers in OJS's Prepared Emails) can be sent to subscribers both before and after a subscription has expired.

Note: To activate these options, the Editor-in-Chief must enable the scheduled_tasks option in the OJS configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OJS documentation.
HTML can be used in textarea (for font size, color, etc.), with "returns" treated as <tt><br></tt>; HTML Editor works with Firefox browsers.
Please select a valid value for the number of months after subscription expiry.
Please select a valid value for the number of months before subscription expiry.
Please select a valid value for the number of weeks after subscription expiry.
Please select a valid value for the number of weeks before subscription expiry.
Registered readers will have the option of receiving the table of contents by email when a book becomes open access.

Note: To activate this option, the Editor-in-Chief must enable the scheduled_tasks option in the OJS configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OJS documentation.
Automated email notifications (available for editing by Imprint Managers in OJS's Prepared Emails) can be sent to the Subscription Manager upon the completion of subscription online payments.
Notify Subscription Manager by email upon online purchase of an Individual subscription.
Notify Subscription Manager by email upon online purchase of an Institutional subscription (recommended).
Notify Subscription Manager by email upon online renewal of an Individual subscription.
Notify Subscription Manager by email upon online renewal of an Institutional subscription.
Note: Institutional subscriptions purchased online require approval of the provided domain and IP ranges and activation of the subscription by the Subscription Manager.
Note: To enable these options, the Imprint Manager must enable the online payments module, including online payments for subscriptions, under Reader Fees.
Open Access Options For Subscription Journals
Subscription journals can provide "delayed open access" to their published content, as well as permit "author self-archiving" (both of which increase readership and citation of content).

The Subscription Types and fee structure will be automatically placed under Subscriptions on the About the Imprint page, along with the name and contact information for the Subscription Manager. Additional information about subscriptions, such as methods of payment or support for subscribers in developing countries, can be added here.
The contact listed under Subscriptions in About the Imprint.
Your subscription policy settings have been updated.
Are you sure you want to delete this subscription?
Please select a valid subscription status.
Please select a valid subscription type.
A subscription start date is required.
Please select a valid subscription start date.
A subscription end date is required.
Please select a valid subscription end date.
Note: All changes below are to user's system-wide profile.
Send the user an email with their username and subscription details.
Enter membership information if the subscription type requires that subscribers belong to an association or organization.
The selected subscription type requires membership information.

If a domain is entered here, IP ranges are optional.
Valid values are domain names (e.g. lib.sfu.ca).
The selected subscription type requires a domain and/or an IP range for subscription authentication.

If IP ranges are entered here, the domain is optional.
Valid values include an IP address (e.g. 142.58.103.1), IP range (e.g. 142.58.103.1 - 142.58.103.4), IP range with wildcard '*' (e.g. 142.58.*.*), and an IP range with CIDR (e.g. 142.58.100.0/24).
Please enter a valid IP range.
In order to send the user a notification email, the subscription contact name and email address must be specified in the Imprint Setup.
This user already has a subscription for this Imprint.
A subscription type must be created before new subscriptions can be made.
Subscription access privileges are automatically granted to the Imprint's Imprint Managers, Editors, Section Editors, Layout Editors, CopyEditors, and Proofreaders.
Warning! All subscriptions with this subscription type will also be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue and delete this subscription type?
Enter a numeric value (e.g. 40 or 40.00) without symbol (e.g., $).
The cost must be a positive, numeric value.
The number of months the subscription lasts (e.g. 12).
The duration must be a positive, numeric value.
A subscription type format is required.
Please select a valid subscription type format.

Subscriptions require membership information
(e.g. of an association, organization, consortium, etc.)
